item.title: Bulletin updated at 14:02 HKT 25/07/2023
item.description:
At 2 p.m. at the Hong Kong Observatory :
Air temperature : 33 degrees Celsius
Relative Humidity : 67 per cent
During the past hour the mean UV Index recorded at King's Park : 10
Intensity of UV radiation : very high

The Super Typhoon Doksuri over the seas east of Luzon will continue to move northwestwards and enter the northeastern part of the South China Sea. According to the present forecast, Doksuri will enter within 800 kilometres of Hong Kong during the day tomorrow (26 July). The Observatory will issue the Standby Signal, No. 1 later tomorrow. According to the current forecast, Doksuri will maintain as a super typhoon and gradually move towards the coastal areas of eastern Guangdong and southern Fujian on Thursday and Friday (27 and 28 July). Local winds are expected to strengthen. The Observatory will consider the distance between Doksuri and the Pearl River Estuary and assess the latest tropical cyclone warning signal. Under the influence of the outer subsiding air of Doksuri, very hot weather will persist in southern China in the next couple of days, with showers and squally thunderstorms possibly triggered by high temperatures. It will be more showery and windier in the latter part on Thursday and there will be swells. It will be windy with squally heavy showers on Friday and Saturday. Members of the public should be on the alert on the latest weather forecast.

Please be reminded that:
The Very Hot Weather Warning is now in force. The weather is extremely hot and there is prolonged heat! Please pay attention to health conditions. Drink more water and take all necessary protective measures against the heat. Avoid vigorous outdoor physical activities. If feeling unwell, seek medical advice as soon as possible.
